--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "David Zincavage" <jdz@i...> wrote:
> Yes, it's not easy to see how maple leaves or deer antlers are "swift 
as wind, fierce as fire, immovable as mountain," or Takeda or Uesugi 
related.   
> 
> Come to think of it, Milt, you were the underbidder on that very 
tsuba. 
 
Yes, I remember that well. I have a tsuba with monkey on a peach tree.
The elements are different from yours ( monkey vs deer, different 
tree ), of course, but the silhouette is identical ( that is, if you 
darken to obscure the detail, the two tsuba would look the same ).
I have seen your tsuba at Ron's table...........

milt
